attributes.additional_details:
Already over 70% of children living below the poverty line are from working families, and that figure has risen during the pandemic.

We call on the Government to expand free school meals to all under-16s where a parent or guardian is in receipt of Universal Credit or equivalent benefit and provide meals during the Christmas holiday to ensure no child goes hungry.
attributes.background:
During half term food banks, businesses and councils filled the gap after the Government refused to extend free school meals for children during the half-term. 

Statists show nearly 10million people are on furlough and now we’re heading into another lockdown this number could rise.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Extend free school meals over the Christmas period: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/555597

Fund free school meals over school holidays until April 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/555727

Provide the free school meal entitlement throughout the year: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/555723

End child food poverty – no child should be going hungry: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554276
